key_points: California marks one-year anniversary of first COVID-19 vaccine administered in the state.
Governor Gavin Newsom releases an ethnic media column to urge Californians to maintain strong immunity through vaccinations and boosters.
Over 62.7 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine have been administered in California; 86% of all eligible Californians have received at least one dose.
More than 6 million adults in California have received a COVID-19 booster shot.
Governor Newsom stresses the importance of vaccination to slow the virus' spread and protect vulnerable communities.
California introduced first-in-the-nation vaccine measures including mandatory vaccinations for healthcare workers and school attendance requirements.
The state has partnered with over 830 faith-based and community organizations to improve vaccination equity and outreach.
New state guidance includes universal indoor mask mandates regardless of vaccination status and updated mega event and travel advisories.
COVID-19 vaccines and boosters are free for all Californians, regardless of insurance or immigration status.
Governor Newsom urges all eligible Californians to get vaccinated and receive booster shots amidst rising case rates and hospitalizations.
